newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: PRESS DIGEST - Pakistani newspapers - May 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Pakistani newspapers - May 30.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Pakistani press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Pakistan's policy making National Economic Council, has decided not to undertake any new development project during 1997/98 (July-June) due to financial constraints.
- India has accused Pakistan of repeatedly violating its airspace since 1995.
- Pakistan opened its bidding process to the media on Wednesday and its embassy in Washington purchased $70 million worth of wheat from Australia.
- Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves fell to $832.04 million on May 24 from $897.76 million on May 17, the State (central) Bank of Pakistan said.
- Government has set up a committee to work out a formula for effective implementation of the Agriculture tax.

- Policy making National Economic Council approved 95.106 billion rupees public sector development programme for the fiscal year 1997-98 and set gross domestic produce (GDP) growth target at 6 percent.
- National Assembly (lower house) passed the accountabiliy law to curb corruption.
